title: Silversea introduces Grand Expeditions
text:
14:30 Guests save 20% off cruise fares paired with connecting land adventure Luxury expedition cruise line Silversea has announced the launch of Grand Expeditions. Sailing from October 2015, Silversea has created five epic, once-in-a-lifetime combined voyages, each offering guests a unique experience from sea, to land, to sea again. Ranging from 18 to 34 days, the Grand Expeditions begin with an expedition cruise in the Galapágos Islands, before connecting to a land adventure, and ending with a further expedition cruise exploring the coast of Central America, South America, or Antarctica. 
The all-inclusive Grand Expeditions package is orchestrated by Silversea and incorporates cruise fares for Silver Galapagos and Silver Explorer at 20% off the individual published rate. Also featured in the package are hotel accommodations, land tours, return air travel between Ecuador and the Galápagos Islands, intra-tour air travel and ground transportation, as well as charter flights to Ushuaia, if applicable. "Our Grand Expeditions offer a unique blend of overland adventure combined with two amazing expedition cruise experiences - all expertly curated by our destination experts," said Lisa McAuley, Commercial Director UK and Ireland. The Grand Expeditions are briefly recapped as follows: Latin American Delights / 18 Days / October 1 - October 19 Silver Galapagos will explore the western Galápagos Islands, known for spectacular volcanic landscapes, penguin spotting, and snorkelling. Guests enjoy a post-cruise overnight stay in Guayaquil and then fly to Panama to embark Silver Explorer. Sailing from Colón to Guayaquil, guests will witness amazing wildlife, float up river in the Darien Jungle, and discover the beauty of Colombia's Pacific coast. (Combines expedition voyages 8537 and 7522.) South American Sojourn / 25 Days / October 8 - November 2 Genovesa Island's Great Darwin Bay, formed by a collapsed caldera, and Española Island's abundant wildlife highlight this north central itinerary of Silver Galapagos. A two-night, post-cruise stay in Guayaquil features an afternoon tour of the city before guests embark Silver Explorer. Voyaging from Guayaquil to Valparaiso, guests will be immersed in the unique cultures and landscapes of Peru and Chile. (Combines expedition voyages 8538 and 7523.) Frigatebirds, Ice Fields & Fjords / 23 Days / October 22 - November 14 Genovesa Island's Great Darwin Bay, formed by a collapsed caldera, and Española Island's abundant wildlife highlight this north central itinerary of Silver Galapagos. An overnight stay in Guayaquil, flight to Santiago, overnight hotel accommodations in the city, and an enriching wine tour combine to create the perfect interlude for guests prior to embarking Silver Explorer. Chile's breath taking snow-capped mountains, lakes, and fjords are the focus of the concluding expedition, sailing from Valparaiso to Ushuaia. (Combines expedition voyages 8540 and 7524.) Conquer S. America & Antarctica / 34 Days / October 29 - December 2 & Southernmost South America / 26 Days / November 26 - December 22 Silver Galapagos will explore the western Galápagos Islands, known for spectacular volcanic landscapes, penguin spotting, and snorkelling. Guests then enjoy a seven-night land adventure, featuring excursions to Machu Picchu and Iguazu Falls, two of South America's most sought-after destinations, before embarking Silver Explorer in Ushuaia for an incredible journey to discover the marvels of Antarctica. (Expedition voyage combinations are 8541/7525 and 8545/7527.) Related articles
